author: danceratopz
content:
Hey Ahmad, I just had a look how Nethermind's consumes test fixtures today and didn't manage to execute any fixtures from execution-spec-tests... it looks to me like old paths are being used in the `src/Nethermind/Ethereum.Blockchain.Block.Test/Pyspecs/*.cs` files so that the fixtures (available from within ethereum/tests) aren't found. Happy to be wrong, but I was sure enough to gather the info in an issue: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/6166

In general, we could get a faster turn-around if Nethermind retrieved the execution-spec-test fixtures directly, instead of via ethereum/tests. We have them available on our Github releases page, but are open to other suggestions! https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/
